result.name: Le Steak Frites St-Paul
result.adr_address: 405 Rue Saint-Antoine O, Montréal, QC H2Z 2A3, Canada

reviews.text: The food was extremely good. Great service as well! The only thing I found off was the atmosphere. There wasn't enough lights except at the table where you have your meal. I would still recommend this place. You will understand about the atmosphere when you go there  on an evening.

Great food, service, and bring your own wine. 
Casual to date night atmosphere. It was not busy when we went around 9pm in September and there was no wait to be seated. The waitress did a great job of keeping our water glasses filled and checking in with us. Our food orders did not take long. I ordered the lamb shank with fries and my wife ordered the filet mignon. Both dishes were good. 
Expect to pay around $50 a person for an appetizer and main course.
We recommend this place for a nice dinner date or nice group dinner.
Great food. Bring your own drink restaurant
Nice friendly staff but portions small on this visit. Teeny tiny steak.

Service wasn't bad. Actually, the staff were good enough. However m, I found the atmosphere to be a little cold(in regards to mood and temperature. For the meal itself. I had ordered Grilled Salmon, which come with vegetables, and bottomless fries. I felt that I had a small portion of vegetables and they remind of the frozen ones. The fries, themselves were not bad tasting at all... As a whole I feel that there wasn't much room for improvement in the meal, and that it wouldn't be hard to make it either. I give it an 8 out of 10(taste, and health being a factor). When in the washroom, I noticed it was still slightly cold, with no music. While using the blow dryer, I couldn't help but notice that the angle blows the water from my hands to about three feet in front of it(which means you get water on your pants) This was all on a Sunday night, with the place almost dead... A warmer ambience would have gotten a 4. And am curious as to how they are on a busy day.

result.formatted_address: 405 Rue Saint-Antoine O, Montréal, QC H2Z 2A3, Canada

result.name: Novotel Montreal Centre
result.adr_address: 1180 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Z1, Canada

reviews.text: Great hotel if you're attending an event at the Bell Centre! Novotel is a four minute walk. The room was reasonably priced, comfortable and spotless. Parking in the underground lot is an extra $30/night, but that's not terrible for secure parking in downtown Montreal. Nice features from my perspective included the in-room safe and fast elevators (slow elevators drive me bonkers!).

Well appointed room with a very comfortable king-size bed. Very quiet with no internal noise, and minimal outside noise. Very attentive and helpful bilingual staff. An included breakfast would have made this a 5-star from me.

The hotel might look a bit old on the outside but is newly renovated inside. Price at the counter is around 220 per night (unless you're going during long weekends or peak season). The staff were very friendly and helpful when I was booking a room last minute on a Saturday midnight. The room is clean, quite spacious, and quiet. We didn't have the chance to use its facility but they do have a gym.

Stayed at Novotel for two nights after winning a contest so while I didn't pay for the hotel, I gladly would if I come back to Montreal. The hotel is clean, modern, and well kept. The room we had faced a courtyard which somewhat limited privacy but it really cut down on the street noise which I would take for having to keep the sheer curtains drawn. Also the inside rooms are larger which was nice and just like the rest of the hotel it was nicely updated. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the bathroom well appointed with a rain shower head and seperate wand. Staff were very friendly and were quick to pick up that we didn't speak French which was not an issue for any we spoke with. The location is great with quick access to numerous bars, restaurants, and parks, as well as Bell Centre. Its a moderate walk to the harbour and Gay Village which offer a lot too. Overall I had a great stay and would suggest Novotel to anyone looking for a centrally located, modern hotel.

Considering what I paid for this room I expected more. Aside from the room having carpeting I have stayed in Motel 6 and had the same experience. 
First impression when I got in the room and checked the view: The window was gross. It was very obvious a toddler had smeared food on it. Also, why is there no sheet on the bed?? Mattress pad, top sheet and duvet only. No mugs, just Dixie cups for coffee (but no lids so good luck on the go).
If you're looking for a room this basic make sure you're paying 100 bucks for it, not the ) $259+ tax I paid. I can't even give a higher rating based on location because there are several other options in the area at comparable rates. 
Never again.

result.formatted_address: 1180 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Z1, Canada

result.name: Firegrill

result.adr_address: 1490 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1P7, Canada

reviews.text: Seafood linguine pasta was freshly made but missing some spices and herbs.  It was tossed in a pesto sauce which was house made so you could've tasted the freshness.  Waiter was very professional
A lot of restaurants in Montreal are amazing and Firegrill is one of them. All of their steaks are delicious. In my opinion, their prime rib definitely beats The Keg

The food here can only be described as superb. The waiter was extremely friendly and even gave us some information on the city and what events have been going on such as the cities 375th anniversary. I ordered the barbecue chicken with vegetables and it was amazing I had not had chicken that good in so long. The prices were reasonable considering how nice the restaurant was and it's location. Definitely recommend visiting if you are ever in  Montreal.
The food and service were excellent and the prices were reasonable. I really enjoyed eating here.

My wife and I went to Firegrill our first night in Montreal and we couldn't be happier with the choice. My prime rib French dip was the best I've ever had. Most importantly, Spiro, our waiter, was incredible - helpful, kind, and genuinely interested in us. He absolutely made our night! We would recommend this place to anyone!

result.formatted_address: 1490 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1P7, Canada

result.name: Sushi Shop McGill College
result.adr_address: 1200 Avenue McGill College, Montréal, QC H3B 4G7, Canada

reviews.text: I’d give zero stars but 1 would do. Place always messy tables never wiped. Service with a bad attitude
Delicious sushi, all the waitresses are cute and very good service, always go there
A very small sushi shop that doesn't attract a lot of attention, but is definitely worth a try! The food is really good and the service is nice. I recommend it.
Horrible service. Stingy and serving old sushi
Great service, prepared to order.

result.formatted_address: 1200 Avenue McGill College, Montréal, QC H3B 4G7, Canada

result.name: Cora
result.adr_address: 1240 Rue Drummond, Montréal, QC H3G 1V7, Canada

reviews.text: No comparison between this Cora's, and the ones found in Toronto. The fruit was sweet, eggs cooked to perfection, and the service was prompt. The waiters were friendly, and they brought exactly what was order, despite having a rather long list. The crepes tasted freshly made, and they provided drawing activities for the kids. After a perfect brunch, they gave us plastic cups so that our children would remember the experience.
Unexpectedly great breakfast! Presentation was beautiful. Very busy, so expect to not be in and out due to waiter running around
Love going there for lunch. The decor needs some updating but the excellence of the personnel is outstanding.
Great menu selection. Food was very good. Service friendly and fast. Location is in bottom of Best Western hotel. Expect a wait on the weekend

A total classic for those of us who grew up in Quebec. Cora's has great, hearty breakfast fare, with copious amounts of fruit. Drip coffee is better than average, service is as you would expect: friendly bilingual.

If you want to experience what middle-class families treat themselves to when they want to go out for breakfast, you've found it.

result.formatted_address: 1240 Rue Drummond, Montréal, QC H3G 1V7, Canada
900 Place Jean-Paul-Riopelle, Montréal, QC H2Z 2B2, Canada
result.name: Toqué!
result.adr_address: 900 Place Jean-Paul-Riopelle, Montréal, QC H2Z 2B2, Canada

reviews.text:
Had a fabulous dinner at Toque before my evening flight back to Toronto.
The service and ambiance were upscale and pleasant. Unfortunately, we had to rush through the meal. Next time, will plan to enjoy the meal to the fullest 2.5 hours recommended by our server. The duck entree was succulent and delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant if you enjoy French cuisine.

Tried the 7courses tasting menu at $136. All the dishes were nicely constructed but there wasn’t a dish that really made me amazed. The star of the meal was the high quality ingredients instead of the imagination of the chefs.

Went there a few times. The menu is always very creative and the food is good most of the time. This restaurant is where I have eaten the best desserts in my life and some of the most creative meals...

However, for the price, you expect better:
1) It lacks consistency, 2) Little details are not perfect (i.e. Decoration of the plate a bit messy, bread slightly too hard), 3) bring the plates out without making sure the table is ready for the next service.

The being said, I still recommend this place..
Excellent service, the tasting menu + wine pairing is a must. Every dish was better than the last and the wine selection introduced us to some great bottles! 100% would go back
Wonderful dinner. The bartender made me an amazing mysterious drink. I was skeptical because I am very picky, but this restaurant is amazing and pulled off wowing my taste buds over and over again.

result.name: BARROCO
result.adr_address: 312 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 2A3, Canada

reviews.text: so i was walking around Old Montreal .  I passed by this cute little place with an old window and flower pots and stone walls. I felt like I was in Europe.  I decided I have to go in and just have a glass of wine.  The inside was cozy and welcoming.  the stone walls, candles and just the atmosphere took me away to an English cottage.  I had wine, salad and desert. The food was just as amazing as the atmosphere.  I would make it a point to go back there again if I happen to be in Montreal.   Thank you for creating such a great place so we can eat, enjoy and leave with a great memory. To me, this is what life is all about, places that make you feel warm inside and leave you with an everlasting good memory.

The most inventive and fantastic cocktails I've ever had!  Try the "Tea Mule" or the "Smoking Gun."  Excellent presentaion as well.  The food is very good and the atmosphere is cozy and has a speakeasy feel.  We came here all 3 nights of our vacation in Montreal.  One night for dinner and drinks and then the next 2 nights for cocktails before dinner reservations at other restaurants.

Lovely restaurant in the heart of Old Montreal. There are so many restaurants in this area but a lot of them are tourist traps, not this place though, an absolute gem. We picked this place for our 5th anniversary and boy did it deliver. I had a wonderful Paella and loved every bite of it. My girlfriend also had a great time.

Ambience brings you to a medieval setting, service is amazing. Our waiter was so entertaining and helpful. The wine he recommended was a perfect pairing with my dinner. The food was yummy and inventive.
Great place to get a cocktail in Old Montreal. The only problem is there are so many other great places  nearby.  This would make the shortlist in Old Montreal and they have an awesome Gin selection

result.formatted_address: 312 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 2A3, Canada

result.name: McLean's Pub
result.adr_address: 1210 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3B 2T6, Canada

reviews.text: Loud, limited selection of beer, crowded, food is lousy and expensive. Didn't have enough drink menus for an announced event and brushed off the idea of putting it up on the wall once suggested stating that no one would read it...making me and my table no one apparently...very expensive for the low level of quality. Every second I was there all I wanted to do was leave. Avoid unless you are a University student looking to get hammered and even then you'd be better off elsewhere.

I stumbled upon this place walking about Montreal on a business trip and stopped in for a beer and some food to watch a football game. Locals accepted me in like I was a regular. Great atmosphere and the routine was delicious! Thanks guys!!

Great place! Great service: fast, on point, polite! Food is tasty and prices are very reasonable! I got Pepper steak and it was very good! Place has a lot of room, big TVs. There are high chances that I am coming back for more!
Good place to grab a drink! Location is A1, good service and good draft beer! Would go again.
Quaint downtown bar with friendly staff and affordable drinks. There's also an extensive menu with great food. A great place to hang out at after a long day at work.

result.formatted_address: 1210 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3B 2T6, Canada

result.name: Ambrose Hôtel & Café
result.adr_address: 3422 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1R8, Canada

reviews.text: Very comfortable stay. Quirky hotel in a wonderful way. Friendly young eager to please staff went out of their way to be helpful. Economy room was as advertised small but had everything we needed and a very comfortable bed. Great location to many restaurants, Bell centre, nightlife & Old Montreal within walking distance. Great coffee and sweet or savory petite dejeuner offered for small additional fee. Highly recommend this hotel if steps are not an issue.

The rooms are simple but lovely.  The location is fabulous, an easy walk to downtown.  The cafe serves a simple but good breakfast.  Their coffee is to die for!  Excellent barista.  The staff is extremely helpful, and gave us good recommendations for nightspots to check out.  Our one complaint was that they were having problems with the wifi while we were there.
Location is perfect as the basilique and a fair amount of museums is at an average of a 2km walk. Mont Royal is very near and there is a lot of different restaurants on every path you may take.
Amazing place to stay when visiting Montreal. All the staff were extremely welcoming and friendly.
Very nice place, clean room and well priced. Staff was friendly (except for one guy's stank 'tude). Regardless, I'll be back for sure.

result.formatted_address: 3422 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1R8, Canada
1325 Boulevard René-Lévesque O, Montréal, QC H3G 0A1, Canada
result.name: Bistro Laurentien La Coupole
result.adr_address: 1325 Boulevard René-Lévesque O, Montréal, QC H3G 0A1, Canada

reviews.text: Nice atmosphere, especially the terrasse in the summer time. The vegan portabello mushroom burger is a tasty gluten-free, vegan option.
Food is good but I've expected more for the price.
Good food and good service but could have better beer selection.
Great service and food. I often eat here when I'm downtown visiting clients.

I came here since I had a gift card, and was curious to try out the menu.
My gf and I had salmon and beef tartare as an appetizer. I regularly eat tartare and was surprised by how good they were, ok size for an appetizer.
We decided to split the 48$ steak which I was curious to see would live up to its price point! Overall, the steak was very good! Would I pay for 48$ of my money for it probably not but the sauce was good and it was a fair size.
We had a creme brûle for dessert which came with a pudding chômeur . The creme brûle was good but nothing amazing either!

Overall this place is good for dates,  it was calm for a Saturday evening. Food is good, the red wine we had was excellent. If you have the budget for it, it's a decent place and reliable place to come to without expecting anything life changing.

result.name: Universel Déjeuners et Grillades
result.adr_address: 2055 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 1T5, Canada

reviews.text: Great food and even better service. We were checked on many times by different staff. Water and coffee were constantly refilled. Our waitress was so pleasant and the food was perfect. Prices were reasonable. I would recommend this place for a nice breakfast.

Good and generous portions but way too busy. They forgot to bring us one key ingredient in one order and neither of us got toast...and we had to flag people down for coffee refills too. Not worth it for the hassle. Plenty of other good places in Montreal for brunch.

A great little eatery right in the heart of Montreal. We stopped on the spur of the moment for lunch and enjoyed a pleasant al fresco dining experience on the patio. (Late in October, in Montreal, this is really a treat!)
They offer a wide selection for any appetite. My wife had the Universel omelette that was more filling than egg. (Her only complaint was that they didn't have a decent hot sauce to accompany it, so I think that's actually a compliment!)
I had a burger that was HUGE, and served on a pretzel bun. I enjoyed it, but it was done well done, so it was drier than I would have preferred.
The obligatory poutine was tasty, not too salty, and plenty of cheese curds.
Both meals had plenty of sides. Too much, in fact, so we needed a long walk after.
We like it! We'll be back!

After my bachelor party me and three others went here for breakfast. Even though there was a big line up, I spoke with the waitress and let her know that we needed a table fast because we were rushing against the clock to make our flight. They served us fast, the food was great, it is right on the street so there is a great view of life in Montreal on Peel st. I'm going back next time I'm in town!
Went there with my friends for brunch. Everyone order different things from the menu and they were all happy with what they got. Friendly service and good looking and tasty food.

result.formatted_address: 2055 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 1T5, Canada

result.name: Café Vasco Da Gama
result.adr_address: 1472 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 1S8, Canada

reviews.text: Nice spot in downtown area for a quick lunch or your coffee fix. The espressos are good but not amazing. Great selection of sandwiches and salads. Staff is friendly but don’t expect a super fast service. The ambience is relaxed.

Coffee was decent however overpriced. Employees decided to close the store an hour early and indirectly  pressured us to leave.  Before making my purchase we were told they're closing at 7pm, then after I paid cashier/barista told me they will closing at 6pm today so that they can go home early  ...my transaction occurred at 5h53pm....i would have appreciated knowing this before paying so that i can take my drink to go. On a positive note the cafe is nicely decorated. Saturday, September 16, 2017.
Great place for breakfast. Omelette and wraps were all good. Nice coffee and latte.
Cozy ambiance, delicious food and great espresso. Try the natas! Good and and attentive service too.

We came here for lunch around 1pm. The restaurant is almost full but we managed to get a table instantly. The waiter and waitress are friendly. The menu is in French and the waitress tried to explain to us in English.
Order over the counter after getting your table number. Food will be delivered to your table.
We have the Seared Yellowtail Tuna burger, lemon tart and a large Mocha. Total damage $30+ before tips.

result.formatted_address: 1472 Rue Peel, Montréal, QC H3A 1S8, Canada

result.name: Dominion Square Tavern
result.adr_address: 1243 Rue Metcalfe, Montréal, QC H3B 2V5, Canada

reviews.text: Good selection of drinks and food. I ate dinner at the bar and the bartender was a great bartender + waiter. My steak was cooked properly and cocktails were spot on. Good selection of whiskey, bourbon, scotch. This is a place to relax and take your time. Not recommended for a quick bite.

Food was amazing.  To start White fish croquettes with tarragon mayonnaise. Main course braised beef shoulder with cheddar mash and horseradish carrots. Service was quick and friendly. Unique style dark and cozy. Washed down with a Whisky sour and classic old fashion.  Eat here if your in town!
Best part of the weekend, very romantic. The building is old and beautiful. Wine was amazing. Beef shoulder was to die for, and the sticky toffee pudding was the best I've had. Will return next time!
This place is delicious and relaxing. AND, they make a delicious old fashioned. Make a reservation though. (They’re weird if you don’t have one.)
Beautiful service, super relaxing atmosphere, the servers were gracious with our louder bunch. Delicious food!

result.formatted_address: 1243 Rue Metcalfe, Montréal, QC H3B 2V5, Canada
732 Rue Sainte-Catherine, Montréal, QC H3B 1B9, Canada
result.name: 3 brasseurs McGill
result.adr_address: 732 Rue Sainte-Catherine, Montréal, QC H3B 1B9, Canada

reviews.text: Was having a good time catching up with a friend until we saw a mouse crawling on the floor and then under our table. Finished our drinks quickly and left. Sat by the Rue McGill windows. Hopefully the mous doesn’t go to the kitchen often.

We stopped here before our first real day of exploring Montreal on foot.  It was a great place for lunch!  The staff were very friendly to us (I’m sure obvious-looking tourists), and we had a good talk about the place and what it’s like during the evening.  We ordered the Bacon Mac and Cheese and a burger and split it.  The burger was under-seasoned, but with the topping and Ketchup and Spicy mustard was good.  The M&C was VERY good.  Considering we were going to be walking for the majority of the day, we passed on the beer, but I loved the beer menu and several among the patrons had the beers.  The waiter said their Poutine was exceptional, and we said we’d consider that if we had time later in the day (unfortunately we didn’t).  Again, several tables had it and it looked really good.  Definite recommendation from us.  Friendly staff, a very good looking menu, and craft beer.  How can you go wrong?

I always think I'm going to like this place more than I do. The beer is okay, it's not the greatest, but it's acceptable. The food is pretty standard pub food, the prices are more or less reasonable, and the services is usually pretty good. For whatever reason it just doesn't all come together though.

Ordered a traditional hamburger and a cheeseburger with a friend. Menu options were very slim, not much choice but burgers. Both arrived cold, engulfed in huge bun, were bone dry and overcooked. The cheese was not melted at all. They arrived fairly quick which leads me to believe they were precooked. The fries, somewhere along the lines of McCain frozen fries, were also cold and portions were ridiculously small, nothing on the plate but the burger and a small metal tray of fries. Totally unacceptable for what turned out to be nearly $30 plus tax and tip just for the burgers. Beer was good and the service was also good but In a city known for it's burgers and quality food, I won't make this mistake again.
A good place for beer. Food is good salads were not fresh though. Dont order anything with Tuna! Good service and good for sports

result.name: Santos
result.adr_address: 191 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z5, Canada

reviews.text: Wonderful interior; this place has a lot of style and class. We went on a Wednesday and there was some live blues which was surprisingly really well done. Drinks are a little pricey but I suppose that's probably expected for old Montreal. Would definitely come back again.
Was here for a work gathering. The place was beutiful inside the staff were very nice.  Really awesome place to hang out

I went on a Saturday night. I was personally blown away by the music, great selections. I found the appetizers very delicious (tuna tartare /paella). 

My tuna tartare got forgotten (I was actually looking forward to it the most), but as soon as I alerted the waiter, the appetizer arrived in less than 5 minutes! I was very impressed. 

I will definitely return to Santos Bar!

I didn't have any food here, but we came here for drinks after dinner while visiting old montreal. I haven't had that much fun in a long time - the DJ was on fire and had me dancing the night away. The crowd was friendly and everyone was having a good time. This is my new night spot for when I visit again.

Love this place! This place has a great atmosphere with the most delicious cocktails in all of Montreal. The staff are so friendly and chatty. The food is delicious but the tapas proportions are a little small so probably not the best place to have a big meal. Suitable if you fancy having a small food plate with your drinks, although a little expensive for such a small plate. Worth visiting!

result.formatted_address: 191 Rue Saint-Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 1Z5, Canada

result.name: La Brasserie le Pois Penche
result.adr_address: 1230 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O, Montréal, QC H3G 1M2, Canada

reviews.text:
Delicious food in a pleasant brasserie setting.

We had great, friendly service. The recommended french onion soup was the best I have tasted- lots of cheese, great broth. The mushroom-stuffed chicken rolls were superb, accompanied by delicately seasoned vegetables. The creme brûlée was as also excellent, as was the special brownie. Portions were small and prices moderately high, but the Table d'Hote meal package was only $31 Canadian dollars. Worth a visit.
Beautiful decor. Amazing service and an absolutely stunning meal. It was the perfect place to enjoy a birthday dinner!
Amazing service. Amazing food. Reasonable price. Unlike other tourist trap. Would highly recommend and definitely return.

Over priced french bistro, the bread was tasty and fresh, the $14.00 onion soup was tasteless with hardly any cheese, the shrimp cocktail sauce was sweet ketchup.

 the steak was a zombie color grey with a few tan lines however the flavour was good and the meat was tender. the French fries were soggy and thourowly coated with lard. the few vegetables that were discarded on the plate were bitter from reheating.  the tables are old with deep scratches the upholstered chairs are worn and torn.
Excellent experience! I ordered the table d'hotel and it was so good and delicious it includes appetizer, main, sweet and a cup of tea or coffee! And it is only  $27

result.formatted_address: 1230 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O, Montréal, QC H3G 1M2, Canada

result.name: Bistro Le Seingalt
result.adr_address: 1501 Rue Jeanne-Mance, Montréal, QC H2X 2J4, Canada

reviews.text: J'y suis allée à quelques reprises. Les plats sont très appréciés par tous, mais ce qui est le plus génial c'est le service. Les serveurs sont tellement gentils que ça donne le goût de retourner.
Un peu cher mais la nourriture est bonne et l'endroit est magnifique.

C'était la troisième chance que nous donnions à ce resto et c’était la dernière.  Malgré le décor sympathique et le service très attentif, l'important demeure la nourriture.  L'entrée de chèvre chaud sur croûton baignait dans la vinaigrette de la salade qui l'accompagnait.  Mon compagnon avait opté pour le foie de veau qui était plein de filaments.  Il a dû le retourner.  Quant à moi, j'avais choisi la bavette à l'échalote.  En plus d’être très mince, elle était recouverte d'une sauce brune épaisse qui camouflait le goût de la viande.  De plus, l'assiette est arrivée tiède, j'ai aussi dû retourner mon plat pour qu’il soit réchauffé.  Nous nous sommes finalement résolus à ne pas prendre de dessert pour éviter d’ajouter à notre déception  Adieu Seingalt.
C'est ok sans plus
depuis quelque temps la qualite de la cuisine a beaucoup baisse;tout est trop cuit ou rechauffe

result.formatted_address: 1501 Rue Jeanne-Mance, Montréal, QC H2X 2J4, Canada

result.name: Baton Rouge

Photos are copyrighted by their owners

result.adr_address: 1050 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Y8, Canada

reviews.text: Absolutely the worst Baton Rouge I have ever been to. The food is not fresh and they overcharge. They charged more than double any other Baton Rouge for a change in my order. The place is not busy at all which is probably why they don't stock up on fresh food.

The staff were very attentive and friendly. Unfortunately the food was very disappointing. I had the lobster salad. The lobster itself was very nice but the salad was clearly the store bought pre mix variety with mostly cheap lettuce. Most of our group were also not overwhelmed with their food.  For the price and reputation, this place could do better.
An hour and 40 minutes so far with no food. Will never come back or recommend to anyone. Took them 50 min to serve drinks.

Food was good. SERVICE WAS A F-. I don't know how it took 15 mins to get our drinks ? We got the entree before our drinks ? Also never brought us water ! Waiter was always MIA . No utensils. Funny thing is every table was saying the same thing ! Something is clearly wrong in their workflow and needs serious attention !  It kinda ruins your night !  Can't say if it's the waiters or their entire system !
The food is amazing, but the place itself needs some remodeling, it looks very old.

result.formatted_address: 1050 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Y8, Canada

result.name: Ritz-Carlton Montreal
result.adr_address: 1228 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H3G 1H6, Canada

reviews.text: Attended a work training event. Amazing service from the entire staff. From the valet, reception clerk,waiters all 5 stars. Professional, courteous, polite and all very pleasant. As soon as you arrive you are greated by your name. The decor is stunning and the place is impeccable. Great food and great service ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

The most fabulous hotel experience EVER. Enjoyed a romantic weekend there in Oct and all the staff were so wonderful. Everyone was kind and didn't mind that we couldn't speak French. It was nice being connected to Maison Boulud too, the gorgeous restaurant on the main floor. Beautiful brand new indoor rooftop pool too 😃

Went here for high tea at noon. Very great tea with a variety of sandwiches, hot scones (blueberry and plain) with cream, homemade jam and jelly as well as biscuits and small cakes. Very great place to have conversation and feel a little more "royal"!

I walked into the Ritz Carlton in hope of finding the ideal getting-ready suite for my wedding. I had seen pictures but it didn't seem to showcase the beauty of the hotel. The lobby is absolutely stunning, inside and out, and I was getting very excited until I arrived at the front desk. 
It took at least five minutes before I was awknedged, although there was no customer waiting and plenty of your employees on the other side. I requested their attention and when I asked to visit one of the rooms, I was brusquely sent away. I was given a phone number to call if I wanted to visit because I insisted upon it. My good experience stopped at the main desk and I will be spending my wedding day in a different hotel that offers better service.

Stayed here for the weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday and the service was absolutely impeccable! From the reservationist asking if we were celebrating anything to Eric, our porter, seeing that we brought a bottle of champagne and immediately bringing up ice and flutes to Imane at the front desk sending balloons and a little cake to get the party started. They were all so inviting, the room was fabulously appointed and that bathroom.... I could live there and be happy!

result.formatted_address: 1228 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H3G 1H6, Canada

result.name: Essence
result.adr_address: 2001 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Montréal, QC H3A 2A6, Canada

reviews.text: Modern ambiance with nice layout and decor. Great spot to have lunch with colleagues but I suggest calling to reserve prior. Prices are quite decent for the amount of food you get. More importantly, the food is not always consistent depending on what you order nor is it of the highest quality but still good enough to keep going back for lunch. Food comes relatively quick but the service is bad, almost as if some of the staff was just hired for the first time (very clumsy and lost). Not a bad place at all, just not great either.

On behalf of the John Molson Women in Leadership commitee, I would like to say how much we appreciated the friendly staff's support during our event on September 19th. Your help on the days leading up to the event and during that night was greatly appreciated! The food was amazing and our attendees loved the ambiance and the overall experience! We would definitely recommend Essence to anyone looking for a venue for a networking cocktail!

I rated this restaurant 4 stars for what I've ordered for lunch with my colleagues - Tuna Tataki Salad. Tuna was seared perfectly, served on a bed of julienned vegetables and dressed in a light house made vinaigrette. Sometimes we forget that the simplest of fresh ingredients provides the greatest sensory experience.
Food is great, staff is great, it is a little pricy but worth every penny!
Above average food in a warm, modern atmosphere. Very busy at lunchtime, so be sure to book in advance or arrive early.

result.formatted_address: 2001 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Montréal, QC H3A 2A6, Canada
